lines.text: I thought I was too much like your sister to take out.
Well, the content is similar, but the form is different.
That's your opinion, Baby.

[angry]
My name is Anne Leeds, you can call me Anne, Miss Leeds or hey you, anything but Baby.
Hussein, I think your name is beautiful.
In Mecca maybe but not in Brooklyn!
Friends and neighbours the time is right! This could be the night!
Ivy, could you give a lift? For Hussein get a new name we got to find a costumer who can add X and Y and get Z.
Honey, what does "x" means to you?
50 dollars a week and alimony forever.
Mike, another slug.
Hey Tony, how come Baby quit?
Roc wants to talk to you, I know that it's none of my business but I'm curious about why Baby quit.
Eddie, please, don't ask me, if you know what's good for you, don't ask me.

You live like a Casanova with a string of women running up and down the stairs, but when somebody tries to talk to you truthfully you react like an outraged prude. Let me tell you something, you're the museum piece, not me.
It's a good thing you didn't take that bet, Tony baby. That's right - not hits, no runs, no errors.
Oh boy, four burners, two ovens and a spit. The way other people want diamonds, that's how I want that stove.
Please, not the haughty princess bit. Not when my head is splittin' open.
Oh, would you like me to get you an aspirin?
No, no, no. You can't help me bake a cake either, or pass algebra or get over a heartburn
What are you planning to be when you grow up, an old maid?
Somebody told you.
The slumming party in the kitchen is all over. Goodbye.
I don't know what's come into your life lately, but what it's doing to your disposition is a crime.
Well, it's my life, my club and my disposition.
So what do you want? An amusing item for the eggheads back home? A chapter headed, "Interesting morons I've known"?
I'm a girl. An old girl, mind you, but a girl nonetheless. There's certain things we don't tell guys.

Yes, I passed algebra. Yes, I picked a new name - Harry Armotti, it was going to be. But if why I'm beginning to think Baby quit is why she quit, I wouldn't use that name of yours for a million bucks!
I vote, the Board of Education lets me teach, and when it comes to knowing my way around, I'll match myself against any dame in the place!
I spotted you the minute you opened your mouth.
I may have some sort of New England accent, if that's what you mean, but I can't help it any more than you can help your New York accent.
What New York accent?
I want to talk to Patsy about Patsy. She's been like a sleepwalker all week. You know, it's gettin' so the customers are too polite to applaud. They're afraid they'll wake her up.
Stick to the dames that know the score - hello, thank you and goodbye.
Why should a girl like Ivy go to night school? And if she does go to night school, why should she take algebra?
I like you, don't I?
Sure, but you're kind of an oddball.
Give me a break, Tony.
Oh, you said a mouthful. I'm gonna give you a break!
[slugs him]
Me and heartburn are a cinch daily double.
You're very sexy, too, Leon.
Ha, it's true, I don't deny it. I was born that way.
I'm free. I got plenty of dough, a club we run to suit us and not the customers, and sense enough to know when I'm well off.
You know who she reminds me of? My ex.
Oh, that must make you happy. How much was it Tina took you for?
Oh, you must hate doing this so conventionally. What a pity you can't hit me like you did that man in the alley.
Don't kid yourself, honey. If I caught you dipping your fingers in the till, I'd clip you, too. But him I didn't fire because he's good at his job, which you're not. Is that nice and clear?
Perfectly. If you're a thief or a liar, you belong at the Tonic. Otherwise, you don't.
Yeah, you tell 'em, sister. Get a soapbox and tell 'em.
There are two waiters and at least four musicians at the club who I know for a fact hate my guts. Let 'em. I don't care.
Maybe I'm not as insensitive as you are. I do care.
You don't understand about Tony. He's the kind of a guy who could wind up in the clink easy, or drivin' a truck, or somethin'.
I kissed a good-looking girl. It's happened before, and the chances are pretty good it'll happen again.
What has you don't approve of me got to do with where is my secretary?
You're young. You got your health. You don't need reasonably unhappy.
Ivy, you are like an entrance with French horns.
I didn't have dime. I was a big load of nothin' walkin' around.
I stood still for a shelacking because I figured I owed you somethin' after ten years. But that paid me up. If you ever raise your voice to me again let alone your hand, I'll beat your brains out.
In order to have a stove delivered at 7 AM, who did you have to promise what?
But I left Massachusetts because I wanted to meet new people and make new friends. Live a litte.
Not in my club.
Do you know anything about the guy?
I know he's one of your best friends.
Well, if you had any sense, that should be enough.
What they pay to sit on each other's laps it's a crime to take.
What do you mean hiring a girl like that?
What do you mean what do I mean hiring a girl like that?
What's happening?
It don't pay to be honest, that's what's happening.
Tell me, my dear, are you enjoying our contest?
lines.character: Master of Ceremonies at Cooking Contest

lines.text: Go away!
